text: Youngs Creek is a stream in Callaway County in the U.S. state of Missouri. It is a tributary of Stinson Creek. The stream headwaters arise southwest of Fulton at and it flows southeast crossing under U.S. Route 54 and Missouri Route C northwest of Hams Prairie where its course turns north to its confluence with Stinson Creek southeast of Fulton at at an elevation of 614 feet.Missouri Atlas & Gazetteer, DeLorme, 1998, First edition, p. 38 Youngs Creek was named after Judge Ben Young, an early settler. ==See also== *List of rivers of Missouri ==References== Category:Rivers of Callaway County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Missouri
title: Youngs Creek (Stinson Creek tributary)
